title: In Frames: Andhra's coastal village Uppada on the brink

title: The monsoon beats a menacing retreat in Marathwada
content: It has been a month since Marathwada, a drought-prone region, was ravaged by unprecedented floods, leaving 108 people dead and over 45,000 in shelters. Marginal farmers, who form at least 75% of the area‚Äôs farmer population, are the worst affected, many trapped under the burden of debt. Vinaya Deshpande Pandit visits Beed district to find that as farmers wait for government-promised aid, the rabi sowing has been disrupted with the damaged soil and retreating monsoon

title: Climate change, imbalance in fertiliser use kill soil‚Äôs organic carbon: ICAR study
content: Team of scientists study more than two lakh soil samples to find out impact of loss of natural soil carbon, suggests measures to Governments to address situation

title: Exercise Trishul to boost integrated readiness across multiple domains: Defence Ministry

However, it is unlikely to make much impact despite the significant Muslim population in Seemanchal. The BJP is making an attempt to change the mood by raising the issue of alleged infiltration.

title: Over 70% of India‚Äôs prisoners have not yet been found guilty: SC judge
content: Of the 74% undertrials, only 7.91% utilised legal aid available to them, as most of the accused don‚Äôt even know that they have a right to free legal aid, says Justice Vikram Nath during release of NALSAR report

content: Texas A&M keeps defying its recent history of weak finishes, scoring another road win and moving to 9-0 for the first time since 1992 with Saturday's 38-17 rout of Missouri.

content: Cameron and Cayden Boozer thrived in their freshman debut at Duke, with Cameron going for 25 points, 8 rebounds and 5 assists in a blowout win.

content: Lionel Messi's first-half brace propelled Inter Miami to a 4-0 victory over Nashville SC to advance in the MLS playoffs for the first time in club history.

title: Texas Tech LB Rodriguez flashes a Heisman pose
content: Texas Tech linebacker Jacob Rodriguez struck a Heisman Trophy pose during another dominating defensive performance by the ninth-ranked Red Raiders, leading his club to a stifling 29-7 Big 12 victory over previously undefeated No. 8 BYU on Saturday.

title: 'No Bridge, No Vote': 77 Years On, Bihar Villagers Risk Lives To Cross River
content: For the past 77 years across generations, over 8,000 villagers of Pathra, Herhanj and Kewaldih have been waiting for fulfilment of only one demand - a bridge over Mhorhar river that they describe as "river of helplessness".

title: "Dangerous Move": Kerala Chief Minister As Students Sing RSS Song On Vande Bharat Train
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan on Saturday condemned the reported act of the Southern Railway making school students sing an RSS song onboard the newly inaugurated Vande Bharat Express from Ernakulam to Bengaluru.

title: Himachal BJP MLA Hans Raj Faces Child Sexual Abuse Case
content: Himachal Pradesh BJP legislator Hans Raj was booked under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act on the complaint of a woman who alleged she was sexually assaulted when she was minor, the police said on Saturday.

title: 'India@123', '123456' Among Most Commonly Used Passwords In 2025: Report
content: Researchers checked over 2 billion accounts whose passwords were compromised on data breach forums in 2025.

content: In a major case of cyber fraud, a sum of Rs 2.16 crore has been siphoned off after fraudsters hacked email communications between Bengaluru-based Group Pharmaceuticals Ltd and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories in Hyderabad

content: Indian security agencies achieved major success as they arrested two of the country's most wanted gangsters, who have been operating abroad.

content: The child was originally believed to have died while being breastfed earlier this month in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district.

content: A scooterist was left shocked when he received a challan of nearly Rs 21 lakh for not wearing a helmet. The irony was that the scooter he owned cost him just a lakh.

content: The election of Zohran Mamdani as New York City's next mayor has sent a chill across Israel as people come to terms with the victory of a politician propelled by an outspoken pro-Palestinian message that is rare in US politics.

title: Ajit Pawar's Son Will Need To Pay Rs 42 Crore To Scrap Land Deal Amid Row
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday said action in the Pune land deal case is being taken as per law and there is no question of saving anybody.

content: The viral notice, which appears to be issued by the Dev Bhoomi Uttarakhand University, asks all B.Tech CSE and specialisation (2nd year) and BCA (2nd year) students to attend the event.

title: Pak Amends Constitution, Gives Asim Munir Key Role After Op Sindoor Drubbing
content: Pakistan on Saturday brought in a Constitutional amendment to create a new post of chief of defence forces to ensure greater coordination and unified command among the three services.

title: RSS Chief Says Muslims, Christians "Descendants Of Same Ancestors"
content: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh chief Mohan Bhagwat on Saturday said that Hindus are "responsible" for Bharat, asserting that the RSS aims to organise Hindu society for the glory of the nation, not for power.

content: A Rapido bike taxi rider in Bengaluru has been arrested and charged for allegedly trying to grab a woman passenger's legs during a ride in the city, police said.

title: Man Fires Shots At Border Patrol Agents In Chicago During Immigration Raid
content: A man in Chicago fired shots at US Border Patrol agents during an immigration enforcement operation on Saturday, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) said, but the Chicago Police Department said it did not find anyone injured.

title: "As If Congress Is Interested": Minister On "Shortened" Winter Session Charge
content: Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju has hit back at Jairam Ramesh over his jibe at the government over the duration of the winter session of Parliament.

title: Indore: ‚ÄòDrunk‚Äô ASI rams SUV into multiple bikes, kills man; eyewitnesses describe moment
content: A police officer in Neemuch has been suspended and arrested for a fatal crash that killed a teacher and critically injured four others, including his own family. The assistant sub-inspector allegedly drove his SUV into multiple vehicles. Eyewitnesses reported he was heavily intoxicated, with liquor bottles found in his car. The victim's family protested, demanding justice.

title: ‚ÄòI was trying to rub my back‚Äô: Rapido driver to cops in Bengaluru molestation case
content: A Rapido bike-taxi captain was arrested for allegedly sexually harassing a 20-year-old woman passenger in Bengaluru. The accused claimed he was rubbing his aching back, but the victim stated he continued touching her leg despite her objections. Police registered a case after the woman narrated her ordeal on Instagram.

title: 'What‚Äôs the problem?': German tourist harassed by local cabbies in Goa
content: A German travel influencer faced harassment in Goa when local rickshaw drivers demanded an exorbitant fare, forcing him to use the app-based GoaMiles. The situation escalated with threats, police intervention, and a fine for the GoaMiles driver, highlighting a growing turf war impacting tourism.

title: World Cup magic: Kranti Gaud's win helps her father reclaim lost honour
content: Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav has assured that Munna Singh Gaud, the father of women‚Äôs World Cup‚Äìwinning cricketer Kranti Gaud, will be reinstated as police constable. Gaud was dismissed in 2012 after an alleged error during election duty. The announcement came during Kranti‚Äôs felicitation ceremony in Bhopal, where the CM commended the bowler for bringing glory to the nation and her state.

title: ‚ÄòBroken feedback loop‚Äô: Musk criticizes bureaucracy; calls out monopoly culture
content: Elon Musk criticized government programs for their inefficiency, citing a lack of competition and customer feedback. He argued that state-mandated monopolies prevent government services from improving, as citizens have no alternative.  Musk's remarks sparked debate on X, with some agreeing and others highlighting the social obligations of public services.

title: ‚ÄòWar‚Äôs most challenging night‚Äô: Ukraine‚Äôs power generation at ‚Äòzero‚Äô
content: Russia launched a massive wave of drone and missile strikes, crippling Ukraine's energy infrastructure and reducing power generation to zero.  The state power company reported its facilities were completely knocked out, leading to widespread, prolonged power outages across multiple regions as repairs continue.

title: From toasted to roasted: Trump wines sales in military cantonments invite flak
content: US military stores are reportedly selling Trump-branded wines, sparking ethical concerns despite official claims of legality. This incident echoes broader accusations of the Trump family's self-enrichment, including a crypto venture with Pakistan that critics allege strained US-India ties. Lavish White House events during a government shutdown also drew sharp criticism for insensitivity.

title: 'It's T20, but he still... ': South Africa legend praises Rohit; leaves out Kohli
content: Former South African captain Hashim Amla has lauded Indian cricketer Rohit Sharma, naming him among his top T20 batters on the planet at the moment. Amla's glowing remarks, shared in a recent interview, have gained significant traction online. The veteran is anticipated to rejoin the Indian squad for the upcoming ODI series against South Africa, commencing November 30.

title: Canada‚Äôs $1.2 bn plan to woo H-1B visa holders; reveals new immigration plan
content: Canada is rolling out a new immigration strategy, aiming to attract over 1,000 top researchers with a $1.2 billion investment. The nation plans to welcome 380,000 permanent residents annually from 2026-2028.  An accelerated pathway for H-1B visa holders is also in the works, potentially drawing skilled professionals from the US.

title: Mumbai: Man assaults 3 Cooper Hospital doctors after mother‚Äôs death
content: Chaos unfolded at Cooper Hospital following the death of a patient, as the medical staff faced aggression from the deceased's son, leading to an assault on two doctors and an intern. In response, many resident doctors have chosen to go on mass casual leave, voicing their frustrations and fears.

title: Bengaluru rapido driver who 'tried to grab woman's legs' arrested
content: A 28-year-old Rapido bike-taxi driver was apprehended in Bengaluru for allegedly sexually harassing a 20-year-old woman during a ride. The victim shared her ordeal on Instagram, detailing how the driver attempted to grab her legs. Police initiated a case after her complaint, and the accused claims he was trying to rub his back.

title: Uniformity vs identity: State anthem mandatory in WB schools; Darjeeling opts out
content: West Bengal's mandate for schools to sing the state anthem sparked pushback in Darjeeling, where the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration insisted on maintaining local Nepali anthems and prayers. This highlights how daily school rituals become arenas for negotiating language, identity, and belonging, revealing that shared citizenship doesn't necessitate uniform cultural symbols.

title: ‚ÄòNot about compensation‚Äô: Twitter founder defends Musk‚Äôs $1Tn pay; quotes Tesla‚Äôs old post
content: Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey has publicly supported Tesla CEO Elon Musk's proposed $1 trillion pay package. Dorsey stated the compensation is about ensuring a principled engineering approach for the company's future. This support comes as Tesla shareholders prepare to vote on the package at their annual general meeting today, November 6.

title: RBSE to conduct board exams twice a year from 2026‚Äë27
content: Rajasthan Board of Secondary Education (RBSE) will conduct board exams twice a year for Class 10 and 12 students starting from the 2026-27 academic session. The first exam is compulsory, while the second, optional session allows students to improve marks in up to three subjects, with the best performance considered for final results.

title: Asia Cup: ‚ÄòFeels great to finally get to touch the trophy,‚Äô says Suryakumar Yadav
content: The Indian team had earlier declined to receive the Asia Cup winner‚Äôs trophy from PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi, who also serves as the Asian Cricket Council chairperson, citing his anti-India stance. Efforts are now underway to resolve the trophy dispute, with representatives from both cricket boards having met recently in Dubai.

title: ‚ÄòSame method in MP, Chhattisgarh‚Äô: Rahul Gandhi escalates ‚Äòvote theft‚Äô charge; hits out at BJP, EC
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi claims the BJP has stolen votes in Haryana and other states. He alleges a centralized plan involving PM Modi, Amit Shah, and the Election Commission. Gandhi presented data on fake voter entries and duplicate photos. The BJP dismissed the claims as baseless and an attempt to defame institutions.

title: Jaipur horror: Man bludgeoned to death with grinding stone, pestle by enraged wife
content: A 40-year-old technician was allegedly murdered by his wife in Jaipur during a domestic dispute. The 32-year-old accused reportedly used a grinding stone and pestle to strike her husband on the head, leading to his death. Neighbours alerted by the commotion transported the victim to the hospital, where he was declared dead on arrival.

title: Babar Azam hits mega milestone! Joins Viv, Azharuddin and Cook in exclusive list
content: Pakistan‚Äôs star batter Babar Azam added another feather to his illustrious career by completing 15,000 international runs during the third ODI against South Africa on Saturday. The milestone came in the series decider at Iqbal Stadium, Faisalabad, making Babar only the fifth Pakistani to achieve the landmark.

title: Pune man strangles wife, burns body in iron box; read crime novels before murder
content: A Pune businessman, inspired by crime fiction, meticulously planned and executed his wife's murder after suspecting an affair. He strangled her, cremated the body in a custom iron box, and scattered the ashes. Inconsistencies in his statements and call records ultimately led to his arrest, unraveling his chilling plot.

title: Death at dawn: 23-year-old dies as car rams parked truck in Ahmedabad; 2 women injured
content: A tragic early morning accident on SG Road claimed the life of 23-year-old Aryan Batra after his speeding car collided with a stationary truck. Two 21-year-old women, passengers in Batra's car, were seriously injured, with one remaining unconscious. Police are investigating the circumstances, including the direction of travel and potential party attendance.

title: Tampa tragedy: Speeding car fleeing police ploughs into crowd; four dead, 11 injured
content: A speeding car fleeing police crashed into a crowd outside a Tampa bar, killing four and injuring eleven. The driver, Silas Sampson, was attempting to evade law enforcement after street racing. This tragic incident has prompted renewed discussion on police pursuit policies.

title: Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal welcome baby boy; Karan Johar extends his wishes
content: Bollywood stars Katrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal have joyfully welcomed their first child, a baby boy, into the world. The news was met with widespread congratulations from friends, family, and industry colleagues, including filmmaker Karan Johar. Vicky's brother, Sunny Kaushal, expressed his excitement about becoming an uncle, while Vicky's father, Sham Kaushal, shared his profound gratitude for the blessings.

title: It‚Äôs not your belly! Doctor reveals the surprising first sign of weight gain
content: Weight gain begins subtly inside the body, with the tongue being the first area to accumulate fat. This internal fat buildup can lead to snoring, the initial observable sign of weight gain, even in individuals who are not visibly overweight. This phenomenon has been observed in studies, highlighting snoring as a potential indicator of developing obesity.

title: ‚ÄòWill be back‚Äô: PM Modi wraps up Bihar campaign; warns against ‚Äòjungle raj‚Äô return
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded his Bihar election campaign with a confident address, promising to return for the NDA government's swearing-in ceremony. He highlighted welfare schemes, women's empowerment, and development initiatives, while also taking swipes at opposition leaders and their past governance.

title: 4-day school week gets community nod as Missouri voters back pilot districts
content: Two Missouri school districts, Independence and Hallsville, have overwhelmingly won voter approval to continue their four-day school weeks. This marks a significant shift under a new law requiring public consent for non-rural districts. The move is seen as a boost for teacher recruitment and retention, with educators citing improved work-life balance and planning time.

title: Sussanne Khan pens emotional tribute to mom Zarine Khan: ‚ÄòYou took our hearts‚Äô
content: Zarine Khan, wife of veteran actor Sanjay Khan and mother to Sussanne and Farah Khan Ali, passed away at 81. Her daughters shared deeply emotional tributes, remembering her grace, love, and as their guiding light. Zarine Khan's funeral was conducted according to Hindu traditions, attended by close family and friends.

title: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs ‚Äògoodbye‚Äô text hours before death highlights NFL crisis
content: Marshawn Kneeland‚Äôs death at 24 has forced the NFL to confront a serious mental health crisis. Police confirmed the Dallas Cowboys defensive end died by an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound after alarming messages to family. Coaches, teammates, and fans are grieving as dispatch audio reveals the severity of his final hours. Full details inside.

title: Klay Thompson apologises to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle drops ‚ÄòOilers Collection 03‚Äô racing-inspired line
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, has unveiled "Oilers Collection 03," a new capsule inspired by classic motorsport style. The collection blends the Oilers' iconic colors with high-end streetwear and automotive aesthetics, drawing from vintage racing suits and team heritage. Kyle shared a preview on Instagram, highlighting the performance-driven fashion.

title: Virat Kohli had Sachin Tendulkar, who was there with Babar Azam?‚Äô: Azam Khan's bold remark
content: Pakistan cricketer Azam Khan has drawn a comparison between Babar Azam‚Äôs impact on Pakistan cricket and Virat Kohli‚Äôs influence on Indian cricket, highlighting how Babar transformed Pakistan‚Äôs image from a team known mainly for its fast bowlers to one celebrated for batting excellence ‚Äî despite not having the same level of support that Kohli enjoyed during his rise.

title: Watch: Railways employee filmed by passenger throwing garbage from moving train
content: A Railways employee was filmed discarding garbage from a moving train, leading to his immediate dismissal. The incident, captured on video by a passenger, sparked public outrage and renewed concerns about waste management within Indian Railways. The railway authorities have taken swift action, imposing penalties and initiating counseling for staff to prevent future occurrences.

title: November 9: Best time today, as per zodiac sign
content: Hindu astrology emphasizes Shubh Muhurat, auspicious times for new beginnings, believed to invite positive energy and divine blessings. November 9, 2025, falls within the sacred Margashirsha month, dedicated to Lord Vishnu, making it a spiritually significant day. Astrologer Vishal Bhardwaj outlines specific auspicious times for various zodiac signs on this day for different activities.

title: Indian-origin man questioned in Chicago; governor says ‚Äòbecause of his skin color‚Äô
content: An Indian-origin US citizen, working for Illinois DOT, was questioned by masked federal agents about his immigration status and New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani. Governor Pritzker condemned the incident as potential racial profiling. The Department of Homeland Security denied the agents were from ICE or CBP, but the event caused local alarm and school lockdowns.

title: Young Indians increasingly using credit for upskilling & career advancement, finds survey
content: A new wave of financial behaviour is emerging among young Indians as credit transforms from a sign of deficit to a tool for self-investment. According to an mPokket Financial Services survey, over 63% of respondents said credit improved their finances, with many using it for education, career growth, and upskilling‚Äîreflecting a shift toward purpose-driven borrowing in India‚Äôs evolving job market.

title: Priyanka accuses PM Modi of undermining dignity of office
content: Priyanka Gandhi criticized PM Modi's "katta" remarks as unbecoming of his office and accused the NDA of bribing women voters with Rs10,000. She urged voters to choose change to keep families together, highlighting job losses due to privatization and paper leaks, and likened the INDIA bloc's fight to Mahatma Gandhi's struggle for rights.

title: Patrick Mahomes speechless as Brittany joins star-studded NWSL board
content: Brittany Mahomes has joined a star-studded advisory board for the NWSL, focusing on marketing, branding, and player initiatives starting in 2026. This appointment signifies a major cultural shift for the Kansas City Current and women's sports. Patrick Mahomes silently supported the announcement, highlighting Kansas City's growing influence in both men's and women's professional sports.

title: 'Condemn what happened': Nadigar Sangam reacts to YouTuber's question on Gouri G. Kishan
content: The South Indian Artists' Association strongly condemns a YouTuber's indecent question posed to actress Gouri G. Kishan. Association president Nassar highlighted the film industry's respect for women and the need to protect their dignity. He called for strict action against individuals misusing social media platforms and posing as journalists. Measures will be taken to prevent such incidents in the future.

title: Big revelation! When Shah Rukh Khan stepped in to save Cheteshwar Pujara's career
content: Pujara‚Äôs wife, Puja, recalled the incident in her book 'The Diary of a Cricketer‚Äôs Wife': ‚ÄúDestiny impelled him to dash heedlessly to a ball for a catch that was never there; and the result: a ruptured anterior cruciate ligament, an impending surgery and a temporarily halted cricketing career ‚Äî all without playing a single game for KKR.‚Äù

title: Stefon Diggs Reacts After Being Named Father of Aileen Lopera‚Äôs Child
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs faces paternity claims from Aileen Lopera, with a test confirming him as the father, while also expecting a child with Cardi B. Amidst this, Diggs shared a cryptic social media quote about fate. DJ Akademiks also alleged Diggs fathered a child with K‚Äôyanna Barber.

title: Murmu trip to Botswana sparks cheetah hope
content: In a thrilling development for wildlife conservation, India is poised to receive between 8 to 10 cheetahs from Botswana, with the official reveal anticipated during President Murmu‚Äôs upcoming visit. This strategic move builds on the success of earlier translocations from Namibia and South Africa.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Lamar Jackson, Rashid Shaheed thrive down the stretch
content: Rashid Shaheed averaged 11.6 fantasy points, on pace for 83 receptions and 943 receiving yards . Shaheed was a reasonable, deep-league flex option who simply needed better quarterback play . he averaged an ordinary 11.3 yards per catch with QBs Spencer Rattler .

title: Izzo guides Michigan St. past Calipari, Arkansas
content: no. 22 Michigan State beat no. 14 Arkansas 69-66 in a matchup of Hall of Fame coaches . the Spartans grabbed 19 offensive rebounds and converted them into 18 points . freshmen darius Acuff Jr. and Meleek Thomas scored 16 points on 5 of 16 shooting .
